paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR V30M mutation in the context of familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP), detailing its effects on MMP-14 expression and the associated clinical implications.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Overexpression of MMP-14 in sciatic nerve
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We started by analyzing MMP-14 expression in sciatic nerve from 6-month-old Hsf/V30M mice.

functional_data.summary: MMP-14 expression was significantly overexpressed in the sciatic nerve of Hsf/V30M mice compared to control mice.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR V30M mutation segregates with disease in the studied mouse model.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of TTR V30M in the pathogenesis of FAP and its correlation with MMP-14 expression.
key_quotes: the most common mutation related to peripheral neuropathy is TTR V30M
significant overexpression of MMP-14 protein and gene levels were observed when compared to age-matched control mouse strains

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR V30M mutation.
